thread.title: Photos from Thursday’s nor’easter
thread.title_full: Photos from Thursday’s nor’easter - The Boston Globe

author: bostonglobe
title: Photos from Thursday’s nor’easter
text:
By Globe Staff February 09, 2017
Lane Turner/Globe Staff
Valeriy Kolyadych shoveled the walk outside a restaurant in Coolidge Corner.
Lane Turner/Globe Staff
Lina Lennerz, 6, rested on a sculpture in Amory Park.
Keith Bedford/Globe Staff
A woman throws a snowball during a snowball fight in the Boston Common.
Lane Turner/Globe Staff
Harris Hackel, 9, crashed while sledding in Amory Park in Brookline.
Keith Bedford/Globe Staff
The snow didn’t stop this mail carrier from making his rounds in the Back Bay.
Keith Bedford/Globe Staff
Libby Waterfall and Annie Winter sled down a hill in the Boston Common.
Jonathan Wiggs /Globe Staff
Justin Burdick shoveled snow on Front Street in downtown Scituate.
Lane Turner/Globe Staff
Passengers waited for an inbound MBTA Green Line train during heavy snowfall.
Pat Greenhouse/Globe Staff
Sonja Mitchell checkedon “7” while she was clearing snow.
Lloyd Young/Globe Staff
A runner made his way through Franklin Park as the snow and wind started to pick up in Boston.
Keith Bedford/Globe Staff
A woman wrapped in plastic walked through the snow in Back Bay.
Keith Bedford/Globe Staff
A woman ran through the snow with her dog in Boston.
David L. Ryan/Globe Staff
Drivers put their windshield wiper blades up on M Street in South Boston.
Keith Bedford/Globe Staff
Red shovels and blue shovels came together to help workers clear snow from store fronts on Newbury Street.
David L. Ryan/Globe Staff
A woman braced herself against the elements as she walked along Pleasure Bay in South Boston.
Keith Bedford/Globe Staff
The statue of George Washington in the Public Garden seemed unfazed by the snow as a pedestrian walked past.
Keith Bedford/Globe Staff
A man in Boston decided to forego a winter hat as he walked through the city Thursday.
Keith Bedford/Globe Staff
A man worked to remove snow along Newbury Street in the Back Bay.
